author: Jared Diamond
title: Villanova Beats Kansas, Now One Step From Championship - WSJ
text:
SAN ANTONIO—Chaos reigned for much of the 2018 NCAA tournament. 
The Retrievers from University of Maryland Baltimore County made history as the first 16 seed ever to topple a No. 1. Sister Jean, Loyola-Chicago’s 98-year-old chaplain-slash-scout-slash-mascot emerged as a national—check that, international—sensation. Giants from across the country fell before the end of the first weekend, rendering millions of printed-out brackets useless for anything besides a litter box.
...
